Instruction: In a saucepan, combine fresh gooseberries, diced onion, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, and salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the gooseberries are softened and the chutney has thickened, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.
Transfer the gooseberry chutney to a jar or container.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled as a tangy and flavorful side dish.
